intro: Klasea cetinjensis, commonly known as the Cetinje klasea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in mountainous areas, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it is often found in the wild in the area around Cetinje, Montenegro. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
